title: French Open live stream: how to watch Roland Garros semi-finals 2021 for free and from anywhere
author: aatif-sulleyman
summary: Only two matches to Roland Garros glory
article: Such a strange French Open in so many ways, we've well and truly reached the business end of the the competition at Roland Garros. To ensure you don't miss a minute more of the action, you're in the right place to discover how to live stream French Open tennis no matter where in the world you are - including ways to see it absolutely FREE.

The stage is well and truly set for clay specialist Rafael Nadal to try and surpass Federer's record of 20 grand slam single titles, with - as ever - Men's world No. 1 Novak Djokovic looking like the most likely contender to stop him following his victory at February's Australian Open.
Or will it finally be time for one of the new breed like Alexander Zverev or Stefanos Tsitsipas to step out of the shadows. Those two meet in the other men's semi on Friday.

Iga Swiatek stole the show in the Women's draw last year, but the Polish youngster has fallen early this time around - alongside the likes of Serena, Naomi and Ashleigh (for varying reasons, of course).

That means the race for the Suzanne-Lenglen Cup has been blown wide open. The semi-finals are dominated by Eastern Europe, with Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova, Tamara Zidanšek and Barbora Krejčíková all making it through to their first Grand Slam round of four. Greek sensation Maria Sakkari joins them to form the most unlikely of quartets - so who will grab the glory?
It's the second slam of the year, and here's how you can live stream French Open 2021 tennis action from wherever you are in the world.
Unlike with some tournaments (US Open, we're looking at you!), tennis fans in some regions get lucky when it comes to Roland Garros, which is free-to-air in some countries around the world:
UK - ITV4 and ITV Hub streaming service

If you're abroad during the French Open, you'll likely find you're unable to access your domestic tennis coverage like you would at home. This isn't necessarily cause for alarm, but rather the result of geo-blocking - best understood as digital borders that restrict certain services and content to certain parts of the world.

Fortunately, there's a convenient way around this in the form of a VPN. This is a nifty bit of software that lets you swerve around these digital borders, thereby allowing you to globe trot and still access your preferred Roland Garros live stream. It's a completely legal workaround, very affordable, and super easy to use - allow us to explain more.
Use a VPN to watch a 2021 French Open live stream from anywhere

Remember, there are loads of benefits to using a VPN beyond just helping you regain access to streaming services and content from abroad. One of the biggest is security: by using encrypted tunnels, streaming VPNs give you a robust first-line of defense against cybercriminals and government snooping. This makes everyday tasks like online shopping and banking much safer, and many people choose to use one for that reason alone.
